intro: Uvariopsis korupensis, commonly known as the Korup mountain ivy, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by berry-like fruits. Uvariopsis korupensis is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical plant diversity.
